text:
There is a contradiction between the workers.properties Reference Guide (http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/reference/workers.html) and the LoadBalancer HowTo (http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/generic_howto/loadbalancers.html). 

The first doc states that "The workers that are member of load balancer must not appear in the worker.list directive." and "These workers should not appear in the worker.list property!", while the second informs "The workers that are member of load balancer do not need to appear in the worker.list directive." 

Which one is correct? If load balance members really must not appear in the worker.list directive, I suggest to include in the Reference Guide a brief note about why they must not be listed. Besides, if there is a legitimate way of accessing a single node of a load balancer, it should referenced.
Thanks for the suggestion. I tried to clarify in r904234. It will be part of the next release. Since it is a minor change we will not update the online docs in advance.
